en: Hey, Ayako, make your voice louder.
zh: 嘿，绫子，大声点。

en: Hey, Ayako! Please speak louder.
zh: 嘿，绫子，说话大声点儿。

en: Hey, Ayako! Please speak more loudly.
zh: 嘿，绫子，麻烦你说话再大声点。

en: Hey, Ayako. Please speak up.
zh: 嘿，绫子，大声点儿说。

en: Large or small?
zh: 大的还是小的？

en: They rolled along the big road and they rolled along the little road until they were way out in the country.
zh: 他们顺着大路滚，又顺着小路滚，一直滚到了远郊的乡下。

en: This artwork excited much controversy in the world of art.
zh: 这件作品在艺术界引起了很大争议。

en: I want to have a full and enriching student-life.
zh: 我想过一段充实精彩的学生生活。

en: I will be only too pleased to help you.
zh: 我很乐意帮你。

en: Yawn a big long yawn.
zh: 打一个舒舒服服的长哈欠。

en: Taiwanese food is milder than Indian food.
zh: 台湾菜比印度菜清淡。

en: Taiwan was far from being any kind of economic miracle in the 1950s.
zh: 二十世纪五十年代的台湾远称不上什么经济奇迹。

en: While I was in Taiwan, I made friends with him.
zh: 我在台湾的时候跟他成了朋友。

en: I became friends with him while I was in Taiwan.
zh: 我在台湾的时候交到了他这个朋友。

en: Please go over the script.
zh: 请过一遍剧本。

en: Typhoons bring about damage every year.
zh: 台风每年都会造成破坏。

en: The typhoon is gaining strength as it heads for Kyushu.
zh: 台风正向九州移动，而且威力还在增强。

en: The typhoon left behind a trail of destruction.
zh: 台风过境后留下了一片狼藉。

en: The typhoon may cross the Tohoku district.
zh: 台风可能会横穿东北地区。

en: The typhoon has done much harm.
zh: 台风造成了很大的破坏。

en: The typhoon moved in a westerly direction.
zh: 台风向西边移动了。

en: The typhoon became weaker and changed into a storm.
zh: 台风变弱了，转为了暴风雨。

en: The storm did a lot of damage to the crops.
zh: 暴风雨让庄稼损失惨重。

en: The typhoon caused great damage to the crops.
zh: 台风对庄稼造成了巨大的破坏。

en: The typhoon did much damage to the crops.
zh: 台风对庄稼造成了很大损害。

en: The typhoon did a lot of damage to the crops.
zh: 台风让地里的庄稼损失惨重。

en: The typhoon did not a little damage to the crops.
zh: 台风给庄稼造成的损失可不小。

en: The typhoon will approach the Kanto district around two in the afternoon.
zh: 台风会在下午两点左右接近关东地区。

en: The typhoon caused immeasurable damage.
zh: 台风造成的损失无法估量。

en: The typhoon is gone.
zh: 台风已经过去了。

en: Typhoons generally head for Japan.
zh: 台风通常都往日本那边去。

en: There was no electricity for two days in the aftermath of the typhoon.
zh: 台风过后停了两天电。

en: The damage of the typhoon spread over several prefectures.
zh: 台风带来的灾害波及了好几个县。

en: The typhoon has done no harm.
zh: 台风没造成什么危害。

en: The typhoon has lost its power.
zh: 台风的威力已经减弱了。

en: The electricity failed during the typhoon.
zh: 台风期间断电了。

en: We had no school on account of the typhoon.
zh: 因为台风，我们学校停课了。

en: A typhoon prevented us from going on our trip to Okinawa.
zh: 台风害得我们去不成冲绳旅游了。

en: Many flights were canceled, owing to the typhoon.
zh: 因为台风，很多航班都取消了。

en: Many flights were canceled because of the typhoon.
zh: 很多航班因为台风取消了。

en: The train was delayed for one hour on account of the typhoon.
zh: 因为台风，火车晚点了一个小时。

en: The typhoon prevented us from going back to Tokyo.
zh: 台风让我们回不了东京。

en: The typhoon accounted for the closing of school.
zh: 因为台风，学校才停课的。

en: The typhoon led to the school being closed.
zh: 台风导致了学校停课。

en: Because of the typhoon, the school was closed.
zh: 因为台风，学校没开课。

en: The typhoon caused damage in many areas.
zh: 台风让很多地方都受了灾。

en: The typhoon bared the tree of its fruit.
zh: 台风把树上的果子都刮没了。

en: All communication with the mainland was cut off by the typhoon.
zh: 台风切断了和大陆的所有通讯。

en: They might have to cancel the flight because of the typhoon.
zh: 因为台风，他们可能得取消航班。

en: The typhoon caused a tree to tumble on my yard.
zh: 台风吹倒了一棵树，掉在了我院子里。

en: The typhoon knocked down a tree in my yard.
zh: 台风把我院子里的一棵树给刮倒了。

en: Much misery came about because of the typhoon.
zh: 这场台风让很多人遭了殃。

en: The typhoon caused the river to flood.
zh: 台风导致了河道泛滥。

en: The typhoon did great damage to the rice crop.
zh: 台风让水稻损失惨重。

en: We suffered heavy damage from the typhoon.
zh: 这次台风让我们受灾挺严重的。

en: A typhoon is approaching Japan.
zh: 有个台风正朝日本过来。

en: Little did I think there would be a typhoon.
zh: 我压根没想到会有台风。

en: I never dreamed that there would be a typhoon.
zh: 我做梦都没想到会有台风。

en: The typhoon hit Tokyo.
zh: 台风袭击了东京。

en: The typhoon claimed many lives.
zh: 这场台风夺走了很多人的生命。

en: The typhoon gathered strength.
zh: 台风的势力增强了。

en: It was announced that a typhoon was approaching Kyushu.
zh: 广播说有个台风正靠近九州。

en: The typhoon struck the Kanto district.
zh: 台风袭击了关东地区。

en: The typhoon made that difficult.
zh: 台风让那件事变得很难办。

en: The typhoon struck the city, causing great damage.
zh: 台风袭击了城市，造成了巨大的损失。

en: Typhoon No.9 is approaching Shikoku.
zh: 9号台风正在靠近四国。

en: Will Typhoon No. 12 hit the Kyushu district?
zh: 12号台风会刮到九州地区吗？

en: Typhoon No.11 is moving up north at twenty kilometers per hour.
zh: 11号台风正以每小时20公里的速度向北移动。

en: Who's responsible for this mess in the kitchen?
zh: 厨房里这一团糟是谁弄的？

en: Clean up the kitchen.
zh: 把厨房打扫一下。

en: Don't forget to sweep the kitchen clean.
zh: 别忘了把厨房扫干净。

en: There's a foul smell in the kitchen.
zh: 厨房里有股难闻的味道。

en: The lights in the kitchen burned all night.
zh: 厨房的灯亮了一整晚。

en: You must not come into the kitchen.
zh: 你千万别进厨房。

en: There is a cat in the kitchen.
zh: 厨房里有一只猫。

en: How many eggs are there in the kitchen?
zh: 厨房里还有几个鸡蛋？

en: We had next to nothing in the kitchen.
zh: 厨房里几乎什么吃的都没有。

en: Is there any coffee in the kitchen?
zh: 厨房里有咖啡吗？

en: Is there a knife in the kitchen?
zh: 厨房里有刀吗？

en: They are in the kitchen.
zh: 他们在厨房里呢。

en: It is in the kitchen.
zh: 就在厨房里。

en: I smell something burning in the kitchen.
zh: 我闻到厨房里有股糊味。

en: Don't you smell something burning in the kitchen?
zh: 你没闻到厨房里有东西烧糊了吗？

en: I helped Mommy in the kitchen.
zh: 我在厨房里帮妈妈忙。

en: Ever since she fell in the kitchen, she hasn't been all there.
zh: 自从她在厨房摔了一跤后，人就变得有点糊涂了。

en: I helped my mother in the kitchen.
zh: 我在厨房里帮我妈干活。

en: Chase the cat from the kitchen.
zh: 把猫从厨房里赶出去。

en: I must rid my kitchen of cockroaches.
zh: 我得把厨房里的蟑螂都消灭掉。

en: You are supposed to come in person.
zh: 你应该亲自过来的。

en: Representatives made a major breakthrough in the trade talks.
zh: 代表们在贸易谈判中取得了重大突破。

en: The Representative Director supervises Directors' performance of duties.
zh: 代表董事负责监督董事们的履职情况。

en: Whoever the representative is from their division, treat him well.
zh: 不管他们部门派谁当代表，都要好好招待。

en: An option is now under consideration.
zh: 现在正在考虑其中的一个方案。

en: Algebra is my favorite subject.
zh: 代数是我最喜欢的科目。

en: Algebra is a branch of mathematics.
zh: 代数是数学的一个分支。

en: Many pupils are poor at algebra.
zh: 很多学生的代数都学得不太好。

en: Representative democracy is one form of government.
zh: 代议制民主是政府的一种形式。

en: Please list alternate dates.
zh: 请列几个备选日期。

en: Will you go to the party instead of me?
zh: 你能替我去参加那个聚会吗？

en: Men of the rank of captain and below live in this building.
zh: 上尉及以下级别的军人都住在这栋楼里。

en: The captain gave orders for a salute to be fired.
zh: 船长下令鸣炮致敬。

en: The commander was roaring at his soldiers.
zh: 指挥官对着士兵们大声吼叫。

en: The commanding officer marched, with soldiers following behind.
zh: 指挥官在前面走，士兵们跟在后面。

en: The captain ordered his men to gather at once.
zh: 连长命令部下立即集合。

en: The captain commanded the men to march on.
zh: 连长命令部下继续前进。

en: The captain ordered his men to fire.
zh: 连长下令开火。

en: The captain exercised the new recruits with long marches.
zh: 连长带新兵进行长途行军，以此来操练他们。

en: Those approaching retirement age have the choice of working or not working.
zh: 快到退休年龄的人可以选择继续工作，也可以选择不干了。

en: The retired often feel that they are useless and unproductive.
zh: 退休的人常觉得自己没用了，发挥不了什么作用。

en: I'd like to live a quiet life in the country after retirement.
zh: 退休以后，我想去乡下过清静的日子。

en: No wonder the retirement years are often referred to as the golden years.
zh: 难怪人们常把退休后的时光称为“黄金岁月”。

en: I bought a small lot on the hillside in Southern France where I plan to build a retirement home.
zh: 我在南法山坡上买了一小块地，打算在那儿盖一栋退休养老的房子。

en: Those who choose to retire can do so as early as sixty-two, although starting to draw their Social Security distributions at that age would mean that the payments would be reduced by twenty percent.
zh: 想退休的人最早62岁就能退，但那时候开始领社保的话，金额会缩减20%。

en: Before he retired, he had handed over charge of his office.
zh: 他退休前已经把工作交接完了。

en: A farewell party was held in honor of the retiring executive.
zh: 为了欢送那位退休的高管，专门开了个派对。

en: A farewell party was held for the executive who was retiring.
zh: 大家给那位快退休的高管办了个欢送会。

en: I can't say I'm happy about retirement.
zh: 我并没觉得退休是件多开心的事。

en: I've retired and I'm going to take it easy for a while.
zh: 我退休了，打算先歇一阵子。

en: He wasn't earning a large salary when he retired.
zh: 他退休的时候，工资其实并不高。

en: You are expected to put out lamps and heaters before you leave the office.
zh: 离开办公室前，要把灯和取暖器都关了。

en: Sometimes I have to read boring novels.
zh: 有时候我不得不看一些挺无聊的小说。

en: I'm stuck in a rut in my boring job and need to do something new.
zh: 我的工作很枯燥，感觉生活一成不变，得换个新活法了。

en: I am bored to death.
zh: 我快无聊死了。

en: Far from being bored, I had a great time.
zh: 我一点儿也不觉得无聊，反而玩得很开心。

en: Far from being bored, we had a very good time.
zh: 我们一点儿都不觉得闷，玩得可高兴了。

en: I'm bored.
zh: 我挺无聊的。

en: The trumpets sounded the retreat.
zh: 号角吹响了撤退号。

en: What's included in the balance sheet?
zh: 资产负债表里都有哪些项？

en: I want to charter a bus.
zh: 我想包一辆大巴车。

en: Do you have safety deposit boxes?
zh: 你们这儿有保险箱吗？

en: Room for rent.
zh: 有房出租。

en: We have a house for rent.
zh: 我们有一套房子要出租。

en: Seldom does a loan come home laughing.
zh: 借出去的钱，很难笑着收回来。

en: Turn your bag inside out.
zh: 把你的包翻过来，里朝外。

en: The bag was bursting with corn.
zh: 袋子里塞满了玉米，快要撑破了。

en: There is a little money in the bag.
zh: 包里有一点儿钱。

en: The moss is a delicate green fur on fallen logs and rocks, I say to myself.
zh: 我对自己说，倒下的木头和石头上的苔藓，就像一层娇嫩的绿色绒毛。

en: My baby kicks very hard.
zh: 我家宝宝踢得可凶了。

en: What is the purpose of your visit?
zh: 您这次来的目的是什么？

en: Did you enjoy your visit?
zh: 这次玩得开心吗？

en: How long will you stay?
zh: 你打算在这儿待多久？

en: Permit me to stay.
zh: 准许我留下来吧。

en: How was your stay?
zh: 这几天住得怎么样？

en: While in England, I often referred to the guidebook for details of my journey.
zh: 在英国的时候，我经常翻旅游指南看行程细节。

en: Judging from his manner, he is not suitable for this job.
zh: 从他的举止来看，他不适合这份工作。

en: All the workers who are lazy must be fired.
zh: 偷懒的员工都得被开除。

en: Idleness leads to ruin.
zh: 游手好闲只会毁了人。

en: Idleness is only the refuge of weak minds.
zh: 只有意志薄弱的人，才会把无所事事当成避风港。

en: Idleness leads to failure.
zh: 懒惰会导致失败。

en: Idle hands are the devil's tool.
zh: 人闲是非多。

en: The devil finds work for idle hands.
zh: 人闲是非多。

en: Idle hands are the devil's workshop.
zh: 游手好闲是罪恶之源。

en: Idleness is the devil's workshop.
zh: 懒惰是万恶之源。

en: If it were not for his idleness, he would be a nice fellow.
zh: 要不是因为他太懒，他这人其实挺不错的。

en: Although it seemed like a lot of money to spend just because I was too lazy to cut my own lawn, I turned the whole thing over to him.
zh: 虽然就因为懒得自己割草而花那么多钱有点心疼，但我还是全交给他处理了。

en: Laziness is my weak point.
zh: 我这人最大的缺点就是懒。

en: Idleness often accounts for poverty.
zh: 贫穷往往是因为太懒了。

en: Were it not for laziness, he might have been rich.
zh: 要不是因为懒，他可能早就发财了。

en: Those who are lazy will never pass.
zh: 偷懒的人肯定过不了。

en: In the evening the idle man begins to be busy.
zh: 懒人一到晚上就开始瞎忙活。

en: The lazy man frequently neglects his duties.
zh: 懒人经常不好好干活。

en: You don't want to be lazy.
zh: 你可别偷懒。

en: Those who are idle will fail.
zh: 无所事事的人会失败。

en: Avoid those men who are idle.
zh: 离那些游手好闲的人远点。

en: If you are idle, you will have a hard time.
zh: 你要是整天无所事事，日子会很难过。

en: I was scolded by my mother for being lazy.
zh: 我因为偷懒被我妈骂了。

en: There were five patients in the waiting room.
zh: 候诊室里有五个病人。

en: Five patients were in the waiting room.
zh: 候诊室里坐着五个病人。

en: The more he waited, the more irritated he became.
zh: 他越等越烦。

en: The longer we waited, the more impatient we became.
zh: 我们等得越久就越没耐心。

en: Everything comes to him who waits.
zh: 好事总会降临在有耐心的人身上。

en: It is a long road that has no turning.
zh: 凡事总有转机。

en: A watched pot never boils.
zh: 心急吃不了热豆腐。

en: How long will it be?
zh: 还得等多久？

en: I had not waited long before she turned up.
zh: 我没等多久她就出现了。

en: There was nothing for it but to wait.
zh: 除了等也没别的办法了。

en: We had not been waiting long when the moon appeared.
zh: 我们没等多久，月亮就出来了。

en: I had not waited long before Mary came.
zh: 我没等多久玛丽就来了。

en: There's no point in waiting.
zh: 等也没意义。

en: You can enjoy some recorded music while you wait.
zh: 你等的时候可以听听录好的音乐。

en: The waiting car was big and black and shiny.
zh: 在那等着的那辆车又大又黑，亮闪闪的。

en: I had not been waiting long before I heard footsteps coming upstairs.
zh: 我没等多久就听到有人上楼的脚步声。

en: How long do you think we'll have to wait?
zh: 你觉得我们还得等多久？

en: I'll wait for you.
zh: 我等你。

en: Am I waiting in the wrong place?
zh: 我是不是等错地方了？

en: Bored waiting or rushing off at full speed.
zh: 要么等得无聊，要么急着赶路。

en: I am sorry to have kept you waiting.
zh: 不好意思，让你久等了。

en: Sorry to have kept you waiting.
zh: 抱歉，久等了。

en: I'm sorry I kept you waiting.
zh: 对不起，让你久等了。

en: I'm sorry that I kept you waiting.
zh: 很抱歉让你久等了。

en: She is a bit indignant about being kept waiting.
zh: 她因为在那儿等了半天有点生气。

en: I get annoyed when I am kept waiting.
zh: 有人让我干等着，我就会很烦。

en: Where can I catch the bus for Obihiro?
zh: 去带广的大巴在哪儿坐？

en: Too much spoils, too little is nothing.
zh: 多了坏事，少了没用。

en: Some children resort to suicide in order to escape from unbearable pressure.
zh: 有些孩子为了逃避无法承受的压力而自杀。

en: I can't stand it.
zh: 我受不了了。

en: They wanted to negotiate the contract on equal terms.
zh: 他们想在平等的条件下商谈合同。

en: Don't hold your rival cheap.
zh: 别小看你的对手。

en: Don't underestimate your opponent.
zh: 不要低估你的对手。

en: Don't take your opponent lightly.
zh: 别轻视你的对手。

en: There was a discussion on the measures.
zh: 大家讨论了那些措施。

en: I am glad it was someone else who got it.
zh: 我很庆幸是别人拿到了。

en: Foreign trade brings in a large income.
zh: 外贸能带来不少收入。

en: Save your strength.
zh: 省点力气吧。

en: Try to build up your strength.
zh: 尽量增强一下体质。

en: You must eat properly to keep up your strength.
zh: 你得好好吃饭才能保持体力。

en: For appearances sake, I went.
zh: 为了做做样子，我还是去了。

en: What do you do to stay in shape?
zh: 你是怎么保持身材的？

en: He will come provided that he is well enough.
zh: 只要身体吃得消，他就会来。

en: I have sore muscles all over my body.
zh: 我全身肌肉酸痛。

en: My body aches all over.
zh: 我浑身都疼。

en: I have aches and pains all over my body.
zh: 我浑身哪儿都疼。

en: My body itches all over.
zh: 我全身都痒。

en: She was aching from head to foot.
zh: 她从头到脚都在痛。

en: To calculate the volume, multiply the length by the width by the depth.
zh: 算体积就是长乘以宽再乘以深。

en: Great bulk does not always mean great weight.
zh: 块头大不一定重。

en: Have you lost weight?
zh: 你瘦了吗？

en: Stand on the scales.
zh: 站到秤上去。

en: Stand on the scale.
zh: 站到秤上。

en: I can easily give up chocolate to lose weight.
zh: 为了减肥，我很容易就能戒掉巧克力。

en: If you want to lose weight, you should cut down on between-meal snacks.
zh: 想减肥的话，你得少吃零食。

en: May I ask you what your weight is?
zh: 能问问你体重多少吗？

en: I'm very worried about my weight.
zh: 我挺担心我的体重的。

en: I watch my weight very carefully.
zh: 我很在意我的体重。

en: You've put on weight, haven't you?
zh: 你胖了吧？

en: I'm gaining weight.
zh: 我变胖了。

zh: 损失达一百万美元。

en: And, I'm your coach.
zh: 还有，我是你们的教练。

en: The loss amounts to ten million dollars.
zh: 损失达一千万美元。

en: The damage amounted to five million yen.
zh: 损失达五百万日元。

en: Bill took the blame for the loss.
zh: 比尔承担了损失的责任。

en: You cannot lose.
zh: 你不会输的。

en: The child looks up to his father with worship in his eyes.
zh: 孩子满眼崇拜地看着他的父亲。

en: Do you have anyone to look up to?
zh: 你有敬佩的人吗？

en: It made Grandfather's day when his granddaughter gave him a picture she had drawn of him.
zh: 孙女送了爷爷一张亲手画的画像，把爷爷高兴坏了。

en: Being with her grandson always makes her happy.
zh: 和孙子在一起总是让她很开心。

en: Let's enjoy ourselves to our heart's content.
zh: 咱们尽情地玩个痛快吧。

en: My grandchildren give me such a delight.
zh: 孙子孙女们给我带来了很多快乐。

en: The work must be finished before noon.
zh: 这活儿必须在中午前干完。

en: The work has to be finished before noon.
zh: 这项工作必须在中午之前完成。

en: It was not until then that I realized my mistake.
zh: 直到那时我才意识到自己的错误。

en: Don't pull my sleeve.
zh: 别拽我袖子。

en: Have you decided on the subject of your thesis?
zh: 你论文题目定了吗？

en: The graduation is two months ahead.
zh: 还有两个月就毕业了。

en: The graduation ceremony will take place on March 20th.
zh: 毕业典礼将在3月20日举行。

en: The graduation ceremony took place on the morning of the first of March.
zh: 毕业典礼是在3月1日上午举行的。

en: Father gave me a book for graduation.
zh: 爸爸送了我一本书作为毕业礼物。

en: On leaving school, we presented him with a table clock as a token of our thanks.
zh: 毕业离校时，我们送了他一个座钟以表谢意。

en: As soon as he graduated, he left town.
zh: 他一毕业就离开了小镇。

en: I met her a long time after graduation, and she had totally become a housewife.
zh: 毕业很久以后我遇到了她，她已经完全成了个家庭主妇。

en: What will you do after graduation?
zh: 你毕业后打算做什么？

en: What'll you do after graduation?
zh: 你毕业后打算干嘛？

en: Do you wish to make any other transaction?
zh: 您还需要办理其他业务吗？

en: He went on to demonstrate how to use the machine.
zh: 他接着演示了如何使用这台机器。

en: The explosion that followed killed many people.
zh: 随后的爆炸造成了很多人死亡。

en: The thief entered the house at the back door by the open window.
zh: 小偷从后门那扇开着的窗户进了屋。

en: Burglars broke into his house.
zh: 他家进贼了。

en: There are several ways to measure speed.
zh: 测量速度的方法有好几种。

en: Speeding causes accidents.
zh: 开快车容易出事故。

en: Please send it by special delivery.
zh: 请发特快专递。

en: Can you make it special delivery?
zh: 能发特快专递吗？

en: Please send it by express mail.
zh: 请寄快递。

en: I can't keep pace with you.
zh: 我跟不上你的步子。

en: Alphonse looked at the racing clouds, his eyes turned to the sky.
zh: 阿方斯仰头望着天空，看着飞速移动的云。

en: Soon gotten soon spent.
zh: 来得快，去得也快。

en: Run fast, otherwise you will miss the bus.
zh: 跑快点，不然你就赶不上公交车了。

en: Run fast, and you will catch the train.
zh: 跑快点，就能赶上火车了。

en: Run fast, or you will be late for school.
zh: 跑快点，不然上学要迟到了。

en: I am tired from running fast.
zh: 跑得太快，我都累坏了。

en: "Come home early, Bill." "Yes, Mother."
zh: “比尔，早点回家。”“好的，妈。”

en: Whether you drive fast or slow, drive carefully.
zh: 不管开快开慢，都要小心驾驶。

en: I'm going to bed.
zh: 我去睡觉了。

en: I am going to bed.
zh: 我要睡觉了。

en: I am going to bed!
zh: 我睡觉去了！

en: If you can read rapidly and with good understanding, you will probably find it easy to remember a good deal of what you do read.
zh: 如果你能读得又快理解得又好，那你读过的大部分内容应该都很容易记住。

en: The race is not to the swift.
zh: 跑得快不一定能赢。

en: He slowed into step with her.
zh: 他慢下脚步，走到了她身边。

en: That will not make even carfare.
zh: 那点钱连车费都不够。

en: She is struggling helplessly.
zh: 她在无助地挣扎。

en: The footprints continued down to the river.
zh: 脚印一直延伸到了河边。

en: Footprints were left on the floor.
zh: 地板上留下了脚印。

en: This book is my good luck charm; I read it every five months.
zh: 这本书是我的吉祥物，我每五个月就读一遍。

en: This book is my good luck charm. I read it every five months.
zh: 这本书是我的吉祥物。我每五个月读一次。

en: A sprained ankle disabled him from walking for a month.
zh: 他扭伤了脚踝，一个月都没法走路。

en: I'll read a book while you're sleeping.
zh: 你睡觉的时候我读会儿书。

en: I am sorry to encumber you with the children.
zh: 真抱歉，把这些孩子托付给你，给你添麻烦了。

en: Watch your step. The floor is slippery.
zh: 小心脚下，地很滑。

en: Do watch your step.
zh: 走路一定要看路。

en: Watch your step, or else you will trip on the baggage.
zh: 走路看着点，别被行李绊倒了。

en: Watch your step, or you will slip and fall.
zh: 小心点，不然会滑倒的。

en: Watch your step. The stairs are steep.
zh: 小心点，这台阶很陡。

en: Watch your step.
zh: 走路看着点。

en: It's dark, so watch your step.
zh: 天黑，走路小心点。

en: The moment I heard the footsteps, I knew who it was.
zh: 我一听到脚步声，就知道是谁了。

en: I didn't mean to step on your foot.
zh: 我不是故意踩你脚的。

en: Wash your feet.
zh: 去洗洗脚。

en: Bathe your feet to get the dirt off.
zh: 泡泡脚，把脏东西洗掉。

en: In order to keep our feet warm we had to shift from one foot to another and keep moving.
zh: 为了让脚暖和点，我们不得不两只脚不停地换着踩，一直动弹。

en: His bad leg prevented him from winning the race.
zh: 他的腿伤让他没能赢得比赛。

en: We're short of something.
zh: 我们缺了点什么。

en: What do you have your feet for?
zh: 你长这双脚是干什么用的？

en: Soles of the feet are insensitive to heat and cold.
zh: 脚底对冷热不太敏感。

en: My legs are getting better day by day.
zh: 我的腿一天天好起来了。

en: A fast walker can walk six kilometers in an hour.
zh: 走得快的人一小时能走六公里。

en: Watch your toes.
zh: 小心脚趾。

en: Be careful not to drop anything on your feet.
zh: 小心点，别把东西砸到脚了。
